adjectives.description: pestilential (comparative more pestilential, superlative most pestilential)

definitionGroups.group: Of or relating to pestilence or plague.

entries.meaning: (of people, animals, places or substances) Producing, spreading, promoting or infected with pestilence; causing infection.
(of illnesses) Spreading in the manner of pestilence.
examples: A long sicknesse will weary friends at last; but a pestilentiall sicknes auerts them from the beginning.

entries.meaning: (of a period of time) During which pestilence spreads.
examples: Now this pestilentiall Summer being well spent, upon the approach of the Winter, and decrease of the Sicknesse, the King  [â€¦]  drawes nearer to the City of London,

entries.meaning: (figurative) Having a harmful moral effect (especially one that is believed to spread in the manner of pestilence).

examples: Synonyms: annoying, irritating, pestiferous, pestilent, troublesome, vexatious
